title: The $90 Billion Squeeze: What the Triad's Budget Really Means for Your Capture Strategy
description: Two massive funding streams converge at the exact moment the Pentagon tears up its acquisition rulebook. Plus: Hegseth's 8(a) sledgehammer and what it means for defense health contractors.

title: The New Iron Triangle: Meet the Three Leaders Who Will Reshape Military Medicine (Part 2)
description: H2F proves the doctrine works. The telehealth landscape they're inheriting. And what it all means for contractors, beneficiaries, and the warfighter.

title: The New Iron Triangle: Meet the Three Leaders Who Will Reshape Military Medicine (Part 1)
description: Keith Bass, Emil Michael, and Admiral Darin Via. The MHS Triad is here, and they're about to transform how we think about military medicine.

title: Department of War: What the Name Change Really Means for Health IT
description: Defense.gov now redirects to war.gov. This isn't just optics. It's doctrine. Here's what it means for the metric of success in military healthcare.

title: The Audit Mandate: Why Everything Has to Work Now
description: DoD must achieve a clean audit opinion by December 31, 2028. That's not a goal. It's a congressional mandate. Here's why it matters for every defense health program.

title: The Oura Disaster: Lessons for Wearables Vendors
description: The $96M sole-source contract didn't die because WHOOP filed a protest. It died because DHA couldn't audit the data. What this means for the next solicitation.

title: Human Performance Optimization: The Army's Proof of Concept
description: H2F delivers 35% fewer injuries and 37% fewer suicides. At $3 million per brigade, the ROI math works. Why Via wants to scale it across the joint force.

title: GenAI.mil: What 3 Million Users Means for Defense Health
description: Emil Michael launched GenAI.mil, putting Google's Gemini on every DoD desktop. This isn't a pilot program. This is the future of military healthcare delivery.
